intro: Lycianthes tricolor, commonly known as the three-color nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, tri-colored flowers that range from yellow to orange to red, often appearing in clusters. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its fruits are small, berry-like capsules that contain several seeds. Lycianthes tricolor is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
